And you can then see all the account numbers they’ve attributed to that particular name, but unfortunately there are a lot of “Marshall Mathers” with other people and companies on the list. Then there will be a list of data fields like “Account Name” and “Phone Number” and so on, and click “Marshall Mathers” in that list.  Then the right-hand side of the page will have a series of lines for each of the accounts, and you’ll be able to find the right line for “Marshall Mathers” and his RBS account.  Here’s one example: https://ibans.rbs.com/servlet/IBANServlet?action=select&fields=AcntName&sessionID=MCNGRC7GLF.  Now you can read off the IBAN number from the middle of that long line.
